Description: Part of North Ionian pottery multiple eye cup (double bowl and the lowest parts of a third one stacked over it); handles, foot and part of body restored in plaster. Interior glazed with three bands in added red lined in white; exterior slipped cream: each side bears two pairs of large eyes with arching eyebrows and an arrangement of spiral forms to denote the nose; to each side, groups of four thin vertical lines; the handle zone of the bottom bowl is bordered by a thick horizontal band placed between pairs of thin horizontal lines; three bands cover lowest wall and outside of flaring ring foot; underside reserved; inscription incised on lower part of the body.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: Gardner (1888, 82) states this is from the rubbish stratum in the temenos of Aphrodite (Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7).

Boardman dates the vase to the second quarter of the sixth century BC (J. Boardman, The Greeks Overseas (London 1980), p. 132, fig. 153. Also illustrated in G. Schmidt, 'Kyprische Bildwerke aus dem Heraion von Samos', in Samos, vol. VII, (Bonn 1968), pls. 121-122.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A1260)
